page.title: 15WHITKIRK CHURCH
page.content: Whitkirk Church is the{second oldest {church in the city of Leeds.}A church possibly existed at the time of the first Domesday Survey, but the present building dates from the fifteenth century. Records dating back to 1185 refer to a certain Paulinus who was probably the first known vicar of the parish; so this year the church is celebrating its{800th anniversary.} Inside Whitkirk Church is the tomb of John Smeaton, the engineer, while outside in a corner of the graveyard is the grave of the first Mayor of Leeds. Five years ago the church underwent a major restoration, and the interior has been restored as far as possible to its original appearance.
